weather_report:
Subiaco slides into early afternoon under a polished blue dome, the sun already bright enough to etch sharp shadows on the pavement. With clear skies overhead, the UV index will be very high through the early and midafternoon, softening only as the day leans toward evening; the air feels clean and the horizon is crisp, with little to interrupt the light. It’s a day that flatters color and squints the eyes, beautiful but insistent.

Dress light and breathable, a brimmed hat and good sunglasses, sunscreen as routine as keys and wallet, and keep water close. Run errands on the shady side of the street, then duck into a quiet bookstore or an airy cafe while the sun is at its fiercest. Hang a load of washing and let the dry air do its work. Toward late afternoon, when the heat backs off and the light turns honeyed, water the garden, pick up a few groceries on foot, or take a gentle loop through the neighborhood, the sort of walk where you notice the small things you missed at noon.
